{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of abdominal pain, constipation, irritability, and developmental delay, along with the finding of basophilic stippling on peripheral blood smear, suggest lead poisoning. Lead interferes with several steps in the heme synthesis pathway, but the most affected is the conversion of aminolevulinic acid to porphobilinogen, which is catalyzed by the enzyme aminolevulinic acid dehydratase.", "answer_choice": "C. Conversion of aminolevulinic acid to porphobilinogen"}
